<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 305, 304, 320]]<|/det|>
## FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 327, 154, 343]]<|/det|>
Paper 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[710, 305, 908, 320]]<|/det|>
9231/12  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[710, 328, 908, 344]]<|/det|>
October/November 2018  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[845, 350, 908, 365]]<|/det|>
3 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 370, 418, 386]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 392, 467, 408]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: List of Formulae (MF10)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 418, 390, 435]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 448, 787, 464]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 464, 329, 479]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 479, 504, 495]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 495, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 510, 380, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 539, 908, 570]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions in the space provided. If additional space is required, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet. The question number(s) must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 570, 908, 600]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 600, 507, 615]]<|/det|>
The use of a calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 615, 908, 645]]<|/det|>
Results obtained solely from a graphic calculator, without supporting working or reasoning, will not receive credit.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 644, 608, 660]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 673, 608, 689]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 689, 757, 705]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 237, 92]]<|/det|>
It is given that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 92, 581, 144]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 2 & 3 & 1 \\ 0 & -2 & 1 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \end{pmatrix}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 166, 156, 186]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 163, 670, 198]]<|/det|>
Find the eigenvalue of \(\mathbf{A}\) corresponding to the eigenvector \(\begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 0 \\ 0 \end{pmatrix}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 175, 920, 193]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 364, 186, 383]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 364, 789, 384]]<|/det|>
Write down the negative eigenvalue of \(\mathbf{A}\) and find a corresponding eigenvector.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 365, 920, 384]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 735, 191, 754]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 735, 747, 754]]<|/det|>
Find an eigenvalue and a corresponding eigenvector of the matrix \(\mathbf{A} + \mathbf{A}^6\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 737, 920, 756]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 861, 92]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has polar equation \(r = a \cos 3\theta\), for \(- \frac{1}{6}\pi \leqslant \theta \leqslant \frac{1}{6}\pi\), where \(a\) is a positive constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 104, 156, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 104, 240, 123]]<|/det|>
Sketch \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 561, 153, 579]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 561, 673, 581]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the region enclosed by \(C\), showing full working.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 562, 920, 581]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 73, 156, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 73, 574, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the general solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 100, 594, 133]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}x}{\mathrm{d}t^{2}} +2\frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} +x = 4\sin t. \quad [7]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 109, 920, 128]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 735, 92]]<|/det|>
The linear transformation \(\mathbf{T}: \mathbb{R}^{4} \to \mathbb{R}^{4}\) is represented by the matrix \(\mathbf{M}\), where

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[381, 98, 616, 170]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{M} = \left( \begin{array}{cccc}3 & 2 & 0 & 1\\ 6 & 5 & -1 & 3\\ 9 & 8 & -2 & 5\\ -3 & -2 & 0 & -1 \end{array} \right).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 186, 156, 204]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 186, 316, 204]]<|/det|>
Find the rank of \(\mathbf{M}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 186, 920, 204]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 660, 346, 678]]<|/det|>
Let \(K\) be the null space of T.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 689, 153, 707]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 689, 311, 707]]<|/det|>
Find a basis for \(K\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 689, 920, 707]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 78, 96, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(y = \mathrm{e}^{x}u\), where \(u\) is a function of \(x\). The \(r\)th derivatives \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^{r}y}{\mathrm{d}x^{r}}\) and \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^{r}u}{\mathrm{d}x^{r}}\) are denoted by \(y^{(r)}\) and \(u^{(r)}\) respectively. Prove by mathematical induction that, for all positive integers \(n\),

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[212, 125, 787, 165]]<|/det|>
\[y^{(n)} = \mathrm{e}^{x}\bigg(\binom{n}{0} u + \binom{n}{1} u^{(1)} + \binom{n}{2} u^{(2)} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} u^{(r)} + \ldots +\binom{n}{n} u^{(n)}\bigg). \quad (8)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 170, 646, 203]]<|/det|>
[You may use without proof the result \(\binom{k}{r} + \binom{k}{r - 1} = \binom{k + 1}{r}\).]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 81, 97, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 79, 161, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 75, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
By considering the binomial expansion of \(\left(z + \frac{1}{z}\right)^6\), where \(z = \cos \theta + \mathrm{i} \sin \theta\), express \(\cos^6 \theta\) in the form

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[348, 120, 648, 144]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{1}{32} (p + q \cos 2\theta + r \cos 4\theta + s \cos 6\theta),\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 145, 551, 166]]<|/det|>
where \(p\), \(q\), \(r\) and \(s\) are integers to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 147, 920, 165]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 156, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 73, 395, 92]]<|/det|>
Hence find the exact value of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 92, 571, 133]]<|/det|>
\[\int_{-\frac{1}{2}\pi}^{\frac{1}{2}\pi}\cos^{6}(\frac{1}{2}x)\mathrm{d}x. \quad [4]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 561, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of any stationary points of \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 510, 186, 529]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 510, 710, 529]]<|/det|>
Sketch \(C\), stating the coordinates of any intersections with the \(y\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 510, 920, 529]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 507, 92]]<|/det|>
The position vectors of the points \(A, B, C, D\) are

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[277, 98, 717, 119]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{i} + \mathbf{j} + 3\mathbf{k},\qquad 3\mathbf{i} + 4\mathbf{j} + 5\mathbf{k},\qquad -\mathbf{i} + 3\mathbf{k},\qquad m\mathbf{j} + 4\mathbf{k},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 126, 403, 144]]<|/det|>
respectively, where \(m\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 159, 154, 178]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 158, 608, 178]]<|/det|>
Show that the lines \(AB\) and \(CD\) are parallel when \(m = \frac{3}{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 160, 920, 178]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 339, 153, 358]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 339, 747, 358]]<|/det|>
Given that \(m \neq \frac{3}{2}\), find the shortest distance between the lines \(AB\) and \(CD\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 341, 920, 359]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
When \(m = 2\), find the acute angle between the planes \(ABC\) and \(ABD\), giving your answer in degrees.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 524, 92]]<|/det|>
Answer only **one** of the following two alternatives.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 106, 201, 123]]<|/det|>
# EITHER

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 136, 447, 155]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) is defined parametrically by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 163, 611, 185]]<|/det|>
\[x = 18t - t^2 \quad \text{and} \quad y = 8t^{\frac{3}{2}},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 194, 250, 211]]<|/det|>
where \(0 < t \leqslant 4\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 225, 156, 243]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 225, 384, 243]]<|/det|>
Show that at all points of \(C\),

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[421, 243, 576, 282]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}\mathrm{y}}{\mathrm{dx}^{2}} = \frac{3(9 + t)}{2t^{\frac{1}{2}}(9 - t)^{3}}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 255, 918, 273]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 78, 154, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 72, 828, 107]]<|/det|>
Show that the mean value of \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^2y}{\mathrm{dx}^2}\) with respect to \(x\) over the interval \(0 < x \leqslant 56\) is \(\frac{3}{70}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 78, 920, 98]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 153, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the surface generated when \(C\) is rotated through \(2\pi\) radians about the \(x\)-axis, showing full working.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 73, 154, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 497, 92]]<|/det|>
Using the substitution \(x = \sec \theta\), show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 100, 608, 136]]<|/det|>
\[I_{n} = \int_{0}^{\frac{1}{4}\pi}\tan^{2n + 1}\theta \sec \theta \mathrm{d}\theta . \quad [4]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[856, 109, 873, 128]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 153, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 369, 92]]<|/det|>
Deduce the exact value of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 92, 561, 139]]<|/det|>
\[\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{4}\pi}\frac{\sin^{7}\theta}{\cos^{8}\theta}\mathrm{d}\theta .\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 109, 920, 128]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 74, 569, 92]]<|/det|>
## Additional Page  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 104, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
If you use the following lined page to complete the answer(s) to any question(s), the question number(s) must be clearly shown.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 75, 564, 90]]<|/det|>
